TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Animation extends SkiaSharp.SKObject

Docs.summary: Represents a Lottie animation that can be loaded, positioned, and rendered to a canvas.

remarks.para: Skottie is a Lottie animation player built on top of the Skia graphics library. Lottie is an animation file format that allows designers to create animations in tools like Adobe After Effects and export them as JSON files for use in applications.
Use the or factory methods to load an animation, then use or to set the animation state, and finally call to draw the current frame.
For more control over the animation loading process, use to obtain an .

MemberSignature.Value: public double InPoint { get; }
.property instance float64 InPoint

Docs.summary: Gets the animation "in" point.
Docs.remarks: This is the frame number where the animation playback should start. Seek values are clamped to the [, ] range.

.property instance float64 OutPoint

Docs.summary: Gets the animation "out" point.
Docs.remarks: This is the frame number where the animation playback should end. Seek values are clamped to the [, ] range.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Render (SkiaSharp.SKCanvas canvas, SkiaSharp.SKRect dst);
.method public hidebysig instance void Render(class SkiaSharp.SKCanvas canvas, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect dst) cil managed

Docs.param: The canvas to render onto.
The destination rectangle.
Docs.summary: Renders the current animation frame to a canvas.
Docs.remarks: The current frame is determined by the most recent or call. The animation is scaled to fit the destination rectangle while preserving the aspect ratio.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Render (SkiaSharp.SKCanvas canvas, SkiaSharp.SKRect dst, SkiaSharp.Skottie.AnimationRenderFlags flags);
.method public hidebysig instance void Render(class SkiaSharp.SKCanvas canvas, valuetype SkiaSharp.SKRect dst, valuetype SkiaSharp.Skottie.AnimationRenderFlags flags) cil managed

Docs.param: The canvas to render onto.
The destination rectangle.
Render flags that control the rendering behavior.
Docs.summary: Renders the current animation frame to a canvas with the specified render flags.
Docs.remarks: The current frame is determined by the most recent or call. The animation is scaled to fit the destination rectangle while preserving the aspect ratio.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Seek (double percent, SkiaSharp.SceneGraph.InvalidationController? ic = default);
.method public hidebysig instance void Seek(float64 percent, class SkiaSharp.SceneGraph.InvalidationController ic) cil managed

Docs.param: The normalized position in the animation, where 0.0 is the start and 1.0 is the end.
An optional invalidation controller that tracks the regions requiring repaint.
Docs.summary: Sets the animation state at a normalized position.
Docs.remarks: Values are clamped to the [0, 1] interval. When a seek triggers an invalidation, any dirty regions are reported to the optional invalidation controller.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SeekFrame (double frame, SkiaSharp.SceneGraph.InvalidationController? ic = default);
.method public hidebysig instance void SeekFrame(float64 frame, class SkiaSharp.SceneGraph.InvalidationController ic) cil managed

Docs.param: The frame number to seek to.
An optional invalidation controller that tracks the regions requiring repaint.
Docs.summary: Sets the animation state at a specific frame number.
Docs.remarks: The frame number is clamped to the [, ] interval. When a seek triggers an invalidation, any dirty regions are reported to the optional invalidation controller.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SeekFrameTime (double seconds, SkiaSharp.SceneGraph.InvalidationController? ic = default);
.method public hidebysig instance void SeekFrameTime(float64 seconds, class SkiaSharp.SceneGraph.InvalidationController ic) cil managed

Docs.param: The time in seconds to seek to.
An optional invalidation controller that tracks the regions requiring repaint.
Docs.summary: Sets the animation state at a specific time position in seconds.
Docs.remarks: Values are clamped to the animation duration. When a seek triggers an invalidation, any dirty regions are reported to the optional invalidation controller.
